website_summaries.verdict: The Pioneer SP-SB23W is the best affordable sound bar if you care about sound quality, with its outstanding sonics making up for some of its design limitations.
pros: The Pioneer SP-SB23W offers outstanding sound quality for a sound bar, particularly when it comes to the blend between the sub and the main cabinet
Performance is even more impressive considering the size of the tiny wireless subwoofer, which is easy to hide in the room
And there's also built-in Bluetooth for wireless audio streaming
cons: The system's style won't wow you and the sound bar's relatively chunky size might block your TV's remote sensor
The included remote is mediocre and there's no front-panel display for visual feedback while making adjustments

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: The unit failed after about a year of use. It started making loud popping sounds when turning on then eventually the speakers failed and there was no sound output. When working, there were times it was difficult to get the speakers and subwoofer to sync. The subwoofer would also intermittently turn off when there weren’t low frequency sounds going through the unit for several minutes. The sound was decent when working but not worth the money given the poor craftsmanship, which has been noted by several other reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, until it died
customer_reviews.text: Excellent while it worked. Then, one day, 3 1/2 years after purchase, it just stopped producing any sound. I was quite happy with it up until that point, but no amount of troubleshooting with customer support could get it working again. It still looked like it should work (LEDs lighting up, ability to change modes and sources, etc.), but no sound could be produced. Based on the reviews, it looks like I'm not the only one who had this experience. Like I said, though, it was excellent until that point.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Westley

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it once, the subufer was clicking a lot whenever we weren’t playing anything. Because we liked the sound, we Returned it and ordered a new one because we thiught it might have been a defect. The second one came with the same issue. It makes clicking sounds even when we’re using it now!!! Unacceptable!! I’m very dissapointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Martuscelli

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy this soundbar!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware! DO NOT Buy this soundbar! When I first purchased this the sound was excellent, subwoofer excellent, small profile with a wide sound profile when turning the volume up. After 2 years we experienced the same cracking as many other reviewers, and the sound bar completely died. Sad to say, I will not be purchasing and Pioneer products, it was great while it worked, but I was hoping it would last a little longer then 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: JayZ

customer_reviews.title: Faulty optical port and subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Original review: Good sound, nice speaker. But it has a faulty wire in the back that makes the sound cut out repeatedly. Amended review 6 months in: the optical port on the back of the speaker is faulty. Have changed connection wire out multiple times, but sound still cuts out intermittently. Also, subwoofer makes phantom noises when plugged in. Have to keep it unplugged and unused.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but flawed at low volumes
customer_reviews.text: Good enough quality at louder volumes, decent value for the $, and in a year of ownership I've not had any connection problems. However as reviewer "dolphin" mentions, the system shuts down the sub at lower volumes, even when the bassline and contribution from the sub is clear. I find myself grabbing the remote, turning it up a few clicks to get the sub back in, then backing it down, but ultimately the sub will cut out again in another minute. This happens through all 3 inputs, optical, analog, and Bluetooth, fed from various devices. In a few emails back and forth with Pioneer's tech support, there doesn't seem to be any solution.
customer_reviews.author: ecpreston

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving it 2 stars (instead of 1) because the overall sound quality was great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2013. It is now less than 3 years later, and the product is broken (it turns on, but it will no longer emit any sound). Unfortunately, it comes with a one year warranty, and this happened in year 2. The entire time I've owned it, it has sat atop the mantle of my fireplace (a fireplace that has literally never been used), so it was very rarely physically touched. I'm giving it 2 stars (instead of 1) because the overall sound quality was great while it lasted. I don't really have any complaints about the product aside from it breaking inexplicably, but that seems like a pretty severe issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sound bars in the past year. One made by Pioneer and one made by Samsung. The one made by Pioneers definitely has superior sound quality to the Samsung one, although the price was also doubled. One thing I would like to see on the Pioneer sound bar is that it has no digital display nor the volume control can be projected on the TV screen, which makes harder to tell what level of volume is set to. Also the functions on the remote control are rather basic.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but unacceptable failure rate (poor quality electronics).  You've been warned!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased over thirty of these systems for use in classrooms at our state college. While they sound great, over twenty have already failed within 3-4 years all with similar power related issues. Out of warranty and unable to obtain schematics or replacement parts through Pioneer for potential in-house repair.
customer_reviews.author: Jereme Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have had the sound bar for about 2 years. About 3 or 4 months ago it started making a popping noise and not connecting to the sub. Now it won’t work at all. Not like we blast it all the time, I’m in my late 50’s. We just use it to watch TV. Going to shop for a different brand. I spent a little more thinking I would get quality but still just junk after 2 years. Researched the problem and it seems I am not the only one with the same issue. Not just Pioneer but many brands.
customer_reviews.author: Phil M.

customer_reviews.title: The worst company I ever delt with !
customer_reviews.text: There is a huge problem with this item and their customer service. When you turn on the sound bar the bluetooth doesn't work most of the time. The company knows about this but when you try and resolve it with them they "nickel and dime" you to death. I sent them the information that they asked for but then when I did this they made it they wanted something else. They make it so hard to get any Service that I just gave up ! I decided to live with the problem which evidently is exactly what they want !!!!!!!!!!!!!! My advice ! Don't buy this item and if you expect good customer service don't buy anything from them !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Popping noise, no longer working
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. Worked great for about a year, then a popping noise started but would still work after a few power cycles. Then dead. I did online research and found a lot of people had the same exact symptoms and some were successful in repairing it themselves. Apparently the issue is bad capacitors. I located what looked like the 3 bad caps, purchased replacements and soldered them in. But no luck for me, it's possible I damaged the board during the soldering process. It is now making a higher pitched popping noise now.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Crick

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth issues PERSIST!
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding soundbar in ALL aspects.....too bad I have to leave one star for Bluetooth issues. I've been exchanging this unit for over 4 months. First it was the mono audio output from a bluetooth source. NOW with their "updated" units, I have stereo operation when bluetooth connects....BUT.....now I CANNOT CONNECT ANY BLUETOOTH DEVICE AT ALL! I can get the Pioneer device to show up on my (ipod/ipad/ipod touch/macbook pro) bluetooth set up screen but it refuses to allow a connection. Pioneer, please get your head out of your posterior and fix this.
customer_reviews.author: kraut

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and worse customer service, don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this soundbar for many months, the sound is typical or slightly better than other soundbars. The issue for me appears to be a really poor electronics design that caused so many issues and odd behaviors that it is just not worth the money. Today, I started having issues with no sound coming from the soundbar, but the subwoofer performed just fine. Long story short, the customer service is extremely poor and the product is just bad. I can not recommend this product and definitely say buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Davis

customer_reviews.title: The subwoofer box has a blue flashing light as a synching indicator
customer_reviews.text: The set up of the system is fairly easy and instructions are complete. The issue experienced is that when the sub-woofer is not synched with the sound bar there is a blue flashing light indicator. This is not an issue while watching tv with the soundbar turned on; but when turning the tv and sound bar off at night - the living room looks like a K_Mart blue light special promotion. Going to try placing a piece of black electrical tape over the LED.
customer_reviews.author: VT Vagabond

customer_reviews.title: Owned the Soundbar and Subwoofer for about 18 months now ...
customer_reviews.text: Owned the Soundbar and Subwoofer for about 18 months now. Sound quality is exceptional for the price. However, the subwoofer is having Bluetooth connectivity issues. It won't stay connected to the soundbar. It receives an intermittent signal and loses it after a few seconds. The subwoofer is placed within the 10ft radius prescribed in the owner's manual. A $400 soundbar and subwoofer shouldn't break after 18 months of use. The subwoofer and soundbar haven't been abused or dropped. They experience normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamen Moore

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to break!
customer_reviews.text: After just over a year the speakers in the sound bar crackle and the subwoofer rumbles even when no sound is coming from the TV. It's now out of warranty and Pioneer doesn't make replacement parts. This was a CNET editors choice, so I've lost faith in both them and in Pioneer. Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Ehnert

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two years
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound for the price but after about two years I started getting a loud pop with delayed sound, then a loud pop and no sound at all. Internet forums confirm this is quite common with this sound bar and it appears to be cheap capacitors that break. Too expensive to send back to Panasonic for repair so I guess I just write it off. I'm very happy with my Panasonic TV but really disappointed with the quality of the Andrew Jones sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: Big Muddy

customer_reviews.title: Mine now sits useless under my tv while i use the tv stock ...
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after 2 years of use. Lots of similar posts on here about it needing several power cycles to get it to turn back on and overall just not reliable. Mine now sits useless under my tv while i use the tv stock speakers. If you buy, get the extra coverage, your probably going to want it. EDIT*** Tried working with customer service... its out of warranty so I have to go to local repair shop. $50 just to diagnose... and no guarantee on parts and labor cost.... NOT WORTH THE HASSLE BUY A BETTER MORE RELIABLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I chose this sound bar after a lot of research and price comparisons. I actually bought a samsung bar first but returned it because the sound wasn't as rich as I expected. I'm very happy with this. I have it mounted over my TV because the sound was getting absorbed when I had it underneath. The bass can be adjusted to be subtle or as loud as you want. My only critique is that it is difficult to determine what mode the bar is in (music, movie, or voice) and the input (bluetooth, TV, etc.). The remote is adequate. Overall, I recommend this for great sound quality at a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Will develop the infamous "pop" and start dying in one year
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Pioneer, and when it worked, the sound was amazing. But for $399 it should last more than a couple of years. Read the reviews, this soundbar is crap for longevity. It will eventually die, and that eventuality does not justify the cost. I believe it was so bad they have stopped making this soundbar, yet are still selling them. Move right along and do not buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. Subwoofer sounds like a fan is running in ...
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. Subwoofer sounds like a fan is running in it. Overall sound is ok but the sub worries me. Not as good as others claim in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Do not invest in a Pioneer. Terrible experience with product and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: In the 3 years we have had this product, the optical input flap has broken thrice. We have had it repaired twice and now once again it's broken. The nearest service center in 2 hours out and presently parts to this product are unavailable. So I have no choice but to trash the sound bar and find a more reliable and sturdy system. Customer service at Pioneer is also terrible. Would not recommend this brand at all.
customer_reviews.author: GOVINDARAJAN SIVARAJ

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: should have paid attention to negative reviews. Mine was defective out the box and when I tried to use the optical jack it dislodged and fell into speaker. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Staetik

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this Pioneer sound bar because it had good reviews for the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this Pioneer sound bar because it had good reviews for the sound quality. Well that may be true~ if you can get over the LOUD POPPING noises on startup! If that not bad enough, it shuts itself off after startup. So, I goggled the Popping noise issue for the SP-SB23W and found out it is a common problem with this product. It is plagued with bad capacitors and software update issues. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT UNTILL YOU GOOGLE IT FOR POPPING NOISES....Save you money for a better sound bar that works.
customer_reviews.author: Hydra22

customer_reviews.title: Not working anymore
customer_reviews.text: Same story here, after 3 years of usage the unit just makes a popping noise when you turn it on. No sound anymore either thru optical or composite cable.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbi

customer_reviews.title: I loved the sound but my first one went dead about ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. I loved the sound but my first one went dead about 2 years after I first bought it. Call Pioneer tech support and was told there was no problems with a new one, all the bugs were fix. So I bought another and when I got it, it started to pop right away just as my old one did before it died. Pioneer knows there is something wrong with this product and does nothing about it. Will never buy another product from them again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it sounds way better than my samsung 65
customer_reviews.text: it sounds way better than my samsung 65, music is probably its strong point, my couch isn't directly in front of the tv ( go ask the person who constantly rearrange the furniture ) not perfect but i like it.... when the sound is off the subwoofer constantly blinks blue, searching for the sound bar that is turned off, maybe irritating to some sitting in the room with no sound in the dark, i could always turn the power off to the sub...
customer_reviews.author: mason

customer_reviews.title: I just love this speaker bar because it provides the sound I ...
customer_reviews.text: I just love this speaker bar because it provides the sound I was looking for. I did not have a clue about the power of speaker bars so I installed it on my bedroom tv until I get a new one for my den then I will switch. Meanwhile, I have to keep the volume low because of the deep and rich bass sounds. My children upstairs came running down because they were trying to determine which neighbor was having a party. Be a aware that there is some problem with the Bluetooth that I have read about on Cnet. Since I don't use the Bluetooth feature I have not been able to detect the problem.
customer_reviews.author: E. White

customer_reviews.title: sounds great but Bluetooth does not work
customer_reviews.text: The sound is awesome, but I bought this for the Bluetooth and with the exception of the first week, the Bluetooth just doesn't work at all. I've tested on 3 different devices and I keep getting an error "incorrect pin or passkey" when pairing a new device even though I'm never asked to enter a pin or passkey. For the device that I had paired when it worked for the first week, it just says "major sure your device is on and try again". All 3 devices work in other Bluetooth devices so it's clearly the sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Tried several systems ( more expensive that this one) for my large Panasonic TV ( 62") in my "girl cave" that is next to our laundry room. My"Girl Cave" is in busy area of our house ( lots of windows/doors-not good for sound system) but was very happy with the this. I did get help from Stereo Review Mag that my hubby insisted I read. For the area I needed to use, it is great. My only negative is that it would not pair with my remotes for volume-only for on and off and my TV is only 2 years old. Anyway. It is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Locklair

customer_reviews.title: Waste of 300.00 dollars!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Lasted one year and broke. Turns on with a loud "pop" noise then turns right back off. Looked online and MANY people have had this happen. I guess lots of people paid 80.00 to ship to Long Beach Ca. for therm to charge to fix. Should last much longer than one year. Paid 300.00. That's a lot of money for most of us. Don't be taken.
customer_reviews.author: Sam William

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its famous name!
customer_reviews.text: I researched many sound bars and couldn't decide so I bought the pioneer because of its reputation. yes, it's a little more than your average sound bar but it's worth it. It's not as expensive as BOSE by a long shot but the sound is close in quality. I previously bought a sony for my bedroom and can hardly tell the difference between it and the sound from the t.v. Not with pioneer. This things can rattle the room. Easy to install and the sound is killer. Pioneer never disappoints me.
customer_reviews.author: Stonewall

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: This product only lasted 3 years. Started making a popping noise when turned on then would immediately shut off. Found an online forum where several people had the same problem. Apparently the capacitor goes bad on the PCB board. One person said he called Pioneer and they would repair it for $160. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Sub keeps disconecting
customer_reviews.text: I have the sub woofer right below the soundbar less then eighteen inches away, But it keeps disconnecting from its wireless connection. I know when it does it because I hear a bumping noise like something is hitting the outside of the house. Somebody else here is having the same problem and they let us know that you must unplug both speaker and woofer, let it set for fifteen minutes and plug them back in, re-sync the wireless and its good to go for awhile until the next time... I dont know what I am going to do with it, I like the sound when it is all working together...
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but limited connectivity
customer_reviews.text: It is a great soundbar, but I can’t understand why it doesn’t support HDMI in 2018. When using Bluetooth it has a noticeable delay if you’re watching video. Other than that great balance between highs, mids, and lows and very stable Bluetooth connection.
customer_reviews.author: Pivo Braun

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Poor quality. Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well for about a year and then started to emit a very loud popping noise whenever the television was turned on. If you read other reviews this is a common problem related to a cathode. Unfortunately the warranty is only for a year so now I am left with broken sound system. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Crap
customer_reviews.text: The remote subwoofer has constant hiss and just sort of sits there drawing power from it's own ac cord and an irritating blinking light on the back when the unit is turned off. I may just toss the subwoofer and use the soundbar only. I bought because of a good review from CNET
customer_reviews.author: Dogwalker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound, weird BT and VERY poor longevity.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this soundbar - up until it just died on me. It barely lasted a year and now it is one big expensive paper weight. Not okay. I treat my electronics very well and I expected to have this for years to come. Very disappointing. Will not be buying from Pioneer again, I expected a lot more from them. Bluetooth was always a bit funny too, but I never minded that much.
customer_reviews.author: Erik C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound. Then it dies.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound out of this speaker and the sub had just enough to make it all Come together. For its sound quality, I gave it two stars. Reliability of Bluetooth is rather disappointing and it is clunky at best. The soundbar ended up crapping out just two weeks outside of warranty, so this is not a well-made product. Pioneer did little to aid in this, too. Bummer. I’d take another one for free though.
customer_reviews.author: David Strupp

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you want 1 year's service only
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sound bar based on previous reviews. Delivers great sound and bass. Paired with iphone easily and wireless subwoofer paired easily as well. UPDATE 2015 Soundbar started making a thumping sound. I tried to get warranty service but because it was 2 months outside of the warranty period, Pioneer customer service would not give me a claim authorization. This was not purchased to last only 1 year and I used it very little and not so loud. Highly disappointed in this purchase. Now part of a land fill.
customer_reviews.author: JDW

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 4 years fine, used the bluetooth function once
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 4 years fine, used the bluetooth function once, and now they unit won't connect to the subwoofer and it just blinks and nothing plays no matter what I do. Sounded great previously.
customer_reviews.author: Jwesley

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The vocals are great but the sub is just ok. It's tight bass but not as surrounding as a vizio 40" system bass unit. When the speaker is turned off the sub lights stay on. The red light stays constant and the blue light flashes. I put a sticker over the annoying lights. The system is similar to the sound of some quality bookshelf stereo speakers and a subwoofer from a HTIB. I miss my Paradigm Ps1000 sub.
customer_reviews.author: Cafn8d Designs

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this manufacturer defective product!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product! The previous version was defective and the most recent version is also defective. Go online and look for yourself. Mine worked for two weeks and then stopped producing sounds. Each time it would work for minutes or seconds and then sound cuts out and requires the system to be shut off and on to restore. Pioneer customer service is completely non-responsive. Do not buy it. Look for other systems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most everything i could possibly expect!!
customer_reviews.text: It is a really great unit!! Has the appearance of a custom built unit. It sounds really great, but, I wish it had the ability to tweak the sound as I like to hear sound range from high to low and then some. Guess I need to tell you I was a musician and my I am just tuned in that way!! It is way above the norm.I believe most listeners would be blown away by this unit. The unit has limitless volume and very clear sound at insanely high volume. Think I have given you my take on this great unit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Swinford

customer_reviews.title: MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: STOP!!!!!!DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!!Stopped working all together after 8 months and an annoying "popping" sound that started about two months ago. Very disappointed.....not worth paying for shipping to California and waiting 3wks to repair. Thumbs Down!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DIGITOR

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar pure and clear
customer_reviews.text: I'd been on the fence about getting a sound bar for a couple of years. I'd done research off and on but was not pleased with the results. We were not completely pleased with the sound on our 60" LED TV but it was OK. After hearing this sound bar, I wish I'd purchased it long ago. It's made us want to go back and watch all of our movies again. If purity of sound is important to you, this is the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Booms for Gamers and Movies- Thinner on Tunes
customer_reviews.text: It sounds a bit thin for pure music listening- not too dynamic, but is the best sounding bar for movies and video games I've personally heard. The bar does have a high profile and may block your TV remote sensor if your TV is just sitting on a pedestal and you set this directly in front.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound, best sound bar I've heard to date. It's not a replacement for a dedicated receiver and 5.1/7.1 set up, but close. Great for setting on a mantle under a wall hung TV. Most sound bars do fine with movie/television dialog but fail in reproducing CD/MP3 audio, not this one. We use it a lot for listening to music and it sounds really good. Plenty of volume for our kitchen/hearth room area and a very full sound with decent bass from the tiny remote sub.
customer_reviews.author: Atomicdogg

customer_reviews.title: Sounds fine, but the bluetooth doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Sounds fine, but the bluetooth doesn't work. Bad refurb. You can do a LOT better for what they are charging here for a faulty refurb.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Tow

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: If you know about the quality of sound and what tight bass is like, then this sound bar is for you. Hard to find a sound bar that actually sounds good on music, I'm really impressed with the performance of it, in this area. I've brought 2 sound bars, which were a VIZIO and LG and did not like neither one of these as far as sound quality goes. The Pioneer may not have all the tweaks as other sound bars do, but to me sound quality is more important. Also in my opinion it's hard for a sound bar to perform as well as actual speakers do, but this one comes pretty close.
customer_reviews.author: D Bustillos Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Definately worth considering.
customer_reviews.text: This is really an all in one stereo with a freestanding sub, my take. For the money, I like it. And the little sub is something of a gem.
customer_reviews.author: JoeSchmoe

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted to add to the volume of our TV in the presence of children: we have 5. it is great. she is happy. of note, the assembly is also very easy if you have a modern tv. I connected via the optical wire. has 3 different functions for sounds and they are fantastic. have yet to use the Bluetooth but imagine it would be no issue.
customer_reviews.author: soldier44

customer_reviews.title: Works fine until it just dies within a year and Pioneer ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine until it just dies within a year and Pioneer customer service sucks! You end up having to pay for shipping to send it to the ONLY Service Center in the US located in California. I had to call like 7 times to actually get that "help" - truly bad warranty policies.
customer_reviews.author: Ali P

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, when they work. purchased three of these and at 18 mo, 22 mo and 23 mo, all three have failed with the same issues. Each took a couple of months to completely fail but all are factory defective and out of warranty. If you're the type of person that doesn't mind tossing your electronics frequently, then this will work for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: A simple solution for decent sound
customer_reviews.text: This was my original review: This is simple to install and gives much improved audio for films. Remote allows changing mode for voice, music, or films. Now I must add: This failed after 2 years and 1 month. It was returned to the Pioneer service center nearest me. They the reported it was a non serviceable item. (They could have told me before I spent $35 to freight it to them).
customer_reviews.author: CaptPete43

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, I heard about it on "Leo Laporte The Tech Guy Show" and really like that the subwoofer is wireless. I placed it behind the couch to give that whole room feel for the movies and it sounds great. The 7 speakers crank for the music and are clear for the vocals. I primarily use it for TV and I am very satisfied by its performance. It has Bluetooth so I can sync my iPhone or iPad too.
customer_reviews.author: ComputerGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding sound bar, hot garbage reliability.
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound of this soundbar. The first one died after 3 years. I purchased a new one because i was out of warranty, and this one has died too. Real shame. Great speaker, terrible reliability. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: George Purkins

customer_reviews.title: Sad Subwoofer Sings Alone
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years, large popping sound and required multiple power on/offs to get to work, it's finally died and no sound will come out of the soundbar whatsoever and the sad subwoofer sings alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really has a great sound while it works (Mine was working fine for ...
customer_reviews.text: It really has a great sound while it works (Mine was working fine for over 2 years), however I also had the problem many people ran into with this unit. One day the popping noise started when I turned it on and there is no more sound. Do not buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ozgur Arslan

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to switch sources connected to it i
customer_reviews.text: I got this soundbar for my husband who likes to play loud music and hear sports at high volume too. He is impressed with it. The sound is clear and doesn't have any echo, noise etc. It is easy to switch sources connected to it i.e. TV, ipad, computer etc. Also, it looks esthetically pleasing on top of the fireplace right below the TV. I was concerned before it arrived how it will look with the rest of our decor, but it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: entropiana

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. The first one I bought wouldn't connect with the sub-woofer. Returned it, replaced it. One year and a month into having the new one speakers pop any time an audio signal comes through and part of the time no sound. I have to turn off and and then back on. I will be replacing with a different system at my own expense since I'm just out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Needs to last longer that 19 months.
customer_reviews.text: Well, the reason I am writing this review is that, 19 months after purchase, the speaker has broke. Wont turn on, and when it does, it pops and turns off again. It has a one year warranty. It sounded fine while it worked.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound bar choice
customer_reviews.text: We are well pleased with this soundbar. Construction is solid; sound is good/excellent. Remote offers choice of music/movie/dialog (by changing bass level) which is handy. Price is reasonable for level of quality. Easy to set up. One mistake in written instructions for "blue" indicator light when syncing. It was red on our unit. Not a problem with functioning. Top choice of CNET.
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that keep me from giving this product five stars is the week remote. I haven't set it up to work with my TV remote which would solve the problem when using the TV, but not when listening to music. The sounds quality is so nice that I can get past the tiny remote and highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: Positive reviews were on target
customer_reviews.text: very good sound for the money as other reviewers have noted. I bought because of the positive reviews and was not disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced White Elephant
customer_reviews.text: The Pioneer Soundbar is a functionally inferior over priced POS that broke after 6 months. There are better sound systems available for less than half the price. Please do not make the mistake of purchasing this white elephant.

customer_reviews.title: Works for a couple months and then dies. Remote ...
customer_reviews.text: Works for a couple months and then dies. Remote will randomly not respond to input. Buttons on the front of the unit randomly do not respond to input. Need to unplug the unit which then it returns to full volume and cannot turn down because the volume inputs do not work. Will not buy pioneer in the future.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar
customer_reviews.text: Love this system. I am not an audiophile. I was looking for something to give me good sound, that was louder than the speakers in my TV. It's loud and clear and the sub hits good. It was a little taller than I thought. I had to move my TV up.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Schweizer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.  Bluetooth and subwoofer won't sync after 16 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2014. Good: Sounded fantastic - Sounded. Past tense. Bad: Bluetooth worked for only 3 months even though issues were to have been remedied. I *rarely* used the BT, so I didn't send it back. Now..since it is out of warranty...the subwoofer won't sync. No matter what I try. Called Pioneer and they said I can send it in, but said it's possible that it may be cheaper to buy a new one. I have never...never purchased an electronic device that became a boat anchor in 16 months...until now. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Shaklee

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy set-up.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and physically listening to sound systems for our newly purchased T.V., I went with this sound bar and am very pleased. Out of the box set-up is simple and quick. Sound is rich and the wireless sub-woofer can rattle the room if you want it to. While the bar enclosure is larger than many others, you get what you pay for. The real wood construction permits sound quality that plastic, low profile systems can't match. The bar doesn't block the T.V. remote because we have them on different shelves. For the true audiophile, this system may not measure up in some ways, however it is extremely portable if you want to reconfigure a room. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Good sound...bad subwoofer connection.
customer_reviews.text: The sound was great however the Bluetooth subwoofer would not stay connected despite being within 6' of the sound bar. In order to reconnect, we had to unplug the sound bar and plug it back in and allow the sub to reconnect. I really liked the sound, but the connection issue was annoying. I moved to the Sony HT CT660 which has been solid.
customer_reviews.author: Bdog

customer_reviews.title: Less than stellar sound, so-so reliability
customer_reviews.text: It works fine when it works, if you don't mind the less-than-stellar sound, but after a little more than three years, the bar took a complete s*** on me, so out in the garbage in went.
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound bar. Has good sound, however when the power goes out and you power it back up, the sound comes on too loud. Also, it is a little difficult to hand on the why because of the design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until
customer_reviews.text: If you avoid the Bluetooth, this bar sounds nice. I have contacted Pioneer and they have acknowledge my request. They claim they'll send me instructions to return this and have the firm ware updated - you have to be kidding me. Not field programmable? I'm patiently waiting but advise others to stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Stout

customer_reviews.title: Great Bar!  Glad I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: After much reading and research, I finally took a leap and bought this sound bar. I am so glad I did. The sound is great! The wireless subwoofer is very convenient and allows it to be placed anywhere in my living room with no wiring concerns. Many people had an issue with the bluetooth function not working. I have had no issues on this front! The bar receives and plays music from my iPhone, iPad, and macbook like a champ! I am glad I ordered this bar. It is a great addition to all TV shows and movies watched. I don't know why I didn't order it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth sound bar
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth sound bar. Much much better than the built in speakers in the flat TV set. Pairs instantly to my phone to watch Netflix. Easy to install and setup, hooking up the cables in the back is a bit of a pain because the connectors are angled down, but it is only a one time deal, works GREAT.

product_meta.title: Pioneer SP-SB23W Andrew Jones Soundbar System
product_meta.description:
Pioneer SP-SB23W Andrew Jones Soundbar System

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Compact sound system produces remarkable stereo imaging, wider off-axis and enhanced dynamic range.
View larger RAISING THE BAR
For those who demand audio quality that lives up to their HD picture, Pioneer offers the new Speaker Bar System. Designed by internationally renowned speaker designer, Andrew Jones, this compact sound solution produces remarkable stereo imaging, wider off-axis response and enhanced dynamic range. Its speaker cabinet is precision-crafted from composite wood, offering more controlled resonance and truer audio reproduction. Six individual speakers are each driven by their own dedicated amplifier and integrated by an active digital crossover network. This symphony of audio innovations all work together to help create a listening experience that will virtually transport you into the action on screen.

AN AMPLIFIER FOR EACH SPEAKER AND A WIRELESS SUBWOOFER
Pioneer's Speaker Bar is powered by six individual amplifiers--one amplifier for each independent driver. The amps produce up to 28 Watts of power for increased audio dynamics and enhanced overall "headroom" at virtually any volume level. Handling the low frequencies is a wireless subwoofer, featuring a 6.5-inch driver that's powered by a built-in 50-Watt amplifier. Tuned to 42 Hz (-10 dB), the output level can be conveniently adjusted with the Speaker Bar remote.

ANDREW JONES DESIGNED FOR THOSE WHO CARE ABOUT SOUND
Crafted by legendary speaker engineer Andrew Jones to deliver excellent full-range sound from a small, simple solution audio package. As Pioneer's Chief Speaker Engineer, Andrew has designed multiple lines of award winning loudspeakers ranging in price from $99 to $80,000 a pair. He is considered an audio master in the industry.

Powered by six
individual amplifiers.
View larger SONIC INTEGRATION USING ACTIVE CROSSOVER NETWORK.
To help optimize speaker response, vocal clarity and off-axis listening, Andrew Jones added a matching active digital crossover network to the Speaker Bar system. This network allows for higher order filter points, enhancing the audio transitions between the woofers and the tweeters.

Included a remote control unit.
View larger SYSTEM SMARTS WITH REMOTE CONTROL LEARNING MODE
While the Speaker Bar system includes a remote control unit, most people prefer to control everything with their favorite remote. That's why Pioneer gave the Speaker Bar a special learning mode that lets you quickly teach the system to respond to commands from any remote you choose.

Wooden cabinet enclosure
with special curved design.
View larger TRUE RESONANCE FROM A COMPOSITE WOOD CABINET
Most sound bars on the market have enclosures made of plastic. Pioneer's Speaker Bar features a composite wooden cabinet enclosure with a special curved design, helping it resist the "flexing" that can occur when the speakers are at high volume. With its superior resistance to undesirable resonance, genuine wood provides more faithful sound reproduction. 

SONIC STANDARD WITH DOLBY DIGITAL DECODING
Helping to ensure that the entertainment experience is rich and immersive, the Speaker Bar includes Dolby Digital Decoding. The standard in home theater systems, Dolby Digital Decoding delivers crisp, clean dialogue, excellent audio imaging, and powerful deep bass.

Shift between 3 sound modes:
movies, music and dialogue.
View larger THREE SOUND MODES FOR SELECTIVE LISTENING
The Speaker Bar offers three sound modes: Movies, Music and Dialogue. The Movies mode enhances the dynamic, explosive sound characteristics of modern movies. The Music mode is optimized for the most natural reproduction of music. The Dialogue mode optimizes the quality of spoken words, while significantly reducing loud sequences, making it ideal for late night viewing. 

Built in Bluetooth.
View larger GET STREAMING USING BLUETOOTH TECHNOLOGY
Adding even more convenience to the Speaker Bar system is built-in Bluetooth technology. This advanced technology enables you to stream music wirelessly from your compatible smartphone or tablet. Immersive audio doesn't have to be complicated. Pioneer's Speaker Bar system is designed to make set-up simple. With minimal cables to connect and an easy subwoofer synchronization process, you'll be enjoying a remarkable entertainment experience in just minutes.
